DOC.brief_summary: This study pilot test culturally appropriate human papillomavirus ( HPV ) self-test intervention among woman Ohio Appalachia order determine feasibility HPV self-testing potential cervical cancer screen strategy . The intervention group receive culturally appropriate material control group receive standard material HPV self-test device .
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To determine feasibility HPV self-testing potential cervical cancer screen strategy obtain preliminary efficacy data culturally appropriate material self-test use . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I : Participants receive study kit include culturally appropriate instruction use return HPV self-test device photo story information sheet HPV HPV self-testing . Participants ask complete HPV self-test return test HPV testing . ARM II : Participants receive study kit include standard instruction use return HPV self-test device standard information sheet HPV cervical cancer . Participants ask complete HPV self-test return test HPV testing . Participants follow 4 week return HPV self-test device 2 month notification letter send .
DOC.criteria: Ages 3065 No Pap test last 3 year Resident Ohio Appalachia county Not currently pregnant pregnant last 3 month No history invasive cervical cancer No history hysterectomy ; woman eligible pilot randomize control trial ( RCT ) participate focus group help develop study ( focus group institutional review board [ IRB ] approve Protocol 2014C0086 ) preliminary device test ; also require woman read understand English ability provide inform consent , infer upon completion return study eligibility , consent , Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) form
